title: Mean vs Median in a Skewed Distribution: Buying Prices of Cars
question_text: A graph (not shown) of the buying prices of cars at a local dealership reveals that the distribution is skewed to the right. Which of the following statements below is TRUE?

choices.text: The median is the average of the 1 st 1 st and 3 rd 3 rd quartiles.
The mean is less than the median.
The value of the 1 st 1 st quartile minus the minimum is less than the maximum minus the 3 rd 3 rd quartile.
There are more buying prices between the 1 st 1 st quartile and the median than there are between the median and 3 rd 3 rd quartile.
There are more buying prices that are greater than the mean than buying prices that are less than the mean.
